Line 5: Line 5:      
As an abstract concept, ''love'' usually refers to a deep, [[ineffability|ineffable]] feeling of tenderly caring for another person. Even this limited conception of love, however, encompasses a wealth of different feelings, from the passionate desire and intimacy of [[romance (love)|romantic love]] to the nonsexual emotional closeness of [[familial love|familial]] and [[platonic love]]<ref name="PlatonicSchool">{{cite book |last=Kristeller |first=Paul Oskar |title=Renaissance Thought and the Arts: Collected Essays |publisher=Princeton University |year=1980 |id=ISBN 0691020108}}</ref> to the profound [[Henosis|oneness]] or devotion of [[love (religious views)|religious love]].<ref name="Gita">{{cite book |last= Mascaró |first=Juan |title=The Bhagavad Gita |publisher=Penguin Classics |year=2003 |id= ISBN 0140449183}} (J. Mascaró, translator)</ref> Love in its various forms acts as a major facilitator of [[interpersonal relationship]]s and, owing to its central psychological importance, is one of the most common themes in the [[creative arts]].
 
As an abstract concept, ''love'' usually refers to a deep, [[ineffability|ineffable]] feeling of tenderly caring for another person. Even this limited conception of love, however, encompasses a wealth of different feelings, from the passionate desire and intimacy of [[romance (love)|romantic love]] to the nonsexual emotional closeness of [[familial love|familial]] and [[platonic love]]<ref name="PlatonicSchool">{{cite book |last=Kristeller |first=Paul Oskar |title=Renaissance Thought and the Arts: Collected Essays |publisher=Princeton University |year=1980 |id=ISBN 0691020108}}</ref> to the profound [[Henosis|oneness]] or devotion of [[love (religious views)|religious love]].<ref name="Gita">{{cite book |last= Mascaró |first=Juan |title=The Bhagavad Gita |publisher=Penguin Classics |year=2003 |id= ISBN 0140449183}} (J. Mascaró, translator)</ref> Love in its various forms acts as a major facilitator of [[interpersonal relationship]]s and, owing to its central psychological importance, is one of the most common themes in the [[creative arts]].
